intro: Georgina variabilis var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple-flowered georgina, is a flowering plant characterized by its striking violet to purple petals. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in dense clusters and bloom in the spring and early summer. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various soil types.
